attributes.action: Take action now to prevent long covid, complications & deaths due to COVID-19
attributes.additional_details:
All British citizens have an absolute right to life (Article 2, Human Rights Act). Imperial college modelling (2021-07-07, SAGE 93) states “we estimate that lifting restrictions
on 19 July in the context of Delta could lead to a significant third wave of hospitalisations and
deaths” if step 4 was implemented. More time will allow “alternative control strategies such as
boosters doses and vaccination of <18 years to be considered and implemented” (Imperial college
modelling SAGE 92)
attributes.background: The UK government must take urgent action to prevent further excess deaths and the devastating complications of COVID-19 including long covid, by implementing independent and transparent evidence-based recommendations from scientific experts without alteration or political interference

rejection.details:
If what you want is for Covid-19 restrictions not to be lifted, you might like to sign the following petition:

Do not lift Covid-19 restrictions on 19th July: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/590611

We have also published the following petitions, which you might like to sign:

Provide financial support & fund research into interventions to treat long COVID: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/581110

Increased funding for treatment of long covid and other chronic conditions: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/579919

If you want the Government to take an action different to the above petitions, you could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.
